page.title: 04Life in Kettlethorpe/Fenton
page.content: The occupations of those living in Fenton and Kettlethorpe are evenly divided by those working locally, those who work in nearby towns or even further afield and those who are retired. There are several families whose parents have come from the surrounding areas, but there are an increasing number with no family connections nearby. There is no natural gas in the area, so heating and cooking is done by electricity, solid fuel, oil or propane gas. Tanker lorries and the coal man are common sights. Televisions, radios, fridges and washing machines are to be found in almost all homes with an increasing number of freezers. Families feel a car is essential for work, shopping and the children's activities. Most people shop in Gainsborough or Lincoln but many also use the mobile shops.
